cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 105 miles east of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift west-northwest overnight, then turn northwest Tuesday and northeast Wednesday, paralleling the Florida east coast before moving toward Georgia and South Carolina coasts.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Not currently forecast to make landfall in Florida; closest approach just offshore of the Palm Beach–Space Coast corridor

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast from Deerfield Beach through Jupiter Inlet, including Palm Beach County
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40–60 mph) likely late Monday night through Tuesday; hurricane-force gusts possible if the core tracks slightly farther west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along the Palm Beach County shoreline, including Lake Worth/Palm Beach Inlet.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 10 inches may produce flash flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf and dangerous rip currents; isolated tornado risk Tuesday.
